summary:
## Primetime Emmy Awards

The Primetime Emmy Awards, or Emmys, honor the best shows and people in American TV. They're given by the Academy of Television Arts & Sciences. There are three types of Emmys: regular, creative arts (for behind-the-scenes work), and engineering.

The Emmys started in 1949. They're usually held in September, rotating between ABC, CBS, Fox, and NBC. Sometimes, they're moved to Monday to avoid conflicting with NFL games or other events.
title: Primetime Emmy Awards
